properties.areaDesc: Southeast Randolph; Southeast Nicholas; Northwest Pocahontas; Southeast Webster
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 4 at 3:31AM EST until January 5 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Charleston WV
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches,
with locally higher amounts. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph.

* WHERE...Southeast Nicholas, Southeast Webster, Northwest
Pocahontas and Southeast Randolph Counties.

* WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 10 AM EST Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Gusty winds could
bring down tree branches.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow squalls, with a sudden increase in
wind and decrease in visibility in snow and blowing snow, are
possible this evening. Blowing snow will continue into Sunday
morning, as the snow diminishes.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Additional information can be found at
https://www.weather.gov/rlx as well as on our Facebook and
Twitter pages.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM EST SUNDAY
